elements.name: Stay Review Card
elements.description: The primary review micro-interaction card that appears after cleaning photos. Compact design with star rating, optional comment, and 'Same as last time' one-tap option for reviews 5+. Pre-populated with stay metadata to reduce cognitive load. Shows cleaning photo thumbnail for visual continuity. First review includes educational context; subsequent reviews are progressively simpler.

visual_spec.layout: Vertical single-column. Metadata header (thumbnail + property + dates) at top, star rating centered below with 12px gaps, optional comment field, issue flag at bottom. Max width 360px for mobile.

interaction_spec.default: Card visible with metadata header showing property name, dates, cleaning photo thumbnail. Stars outlined in light gray, awaiting tap. Comment field collapsed (placeholder visible).
interaction_spec.loading: No loading stateâ€”optimistic UI. Star selection is instant.
interaction_spec.hover: Stars scale to 1.05x on hover, cursor pointer. Card itself has subtle shadow increase on desktop.
interaction_spec.click: Star tap: instant fill with spring animation (100ms), all stars to left also fill. Haptic feedback on mobile. Selected star and all prior stars show solid #31135D fill.
interaction_spec.empty: If guest dismisses without rating, card slides down with 300ms ease-out. Snooze menu appears with timing options.
interaction_spec.success: After submit: card shows green checkmark animation (300ms scale-in), then slides down and dismisses (400ms). Small toast notification: 'Review submittedâ€”thanks!'

copy_spec.body: For stay 1: 'Your feedback helps future guests find great spaces.' For stays 2-4: (no body text). For stays 5+: 'Same as last time âœ“' button prominent.

before_after.after: Review card appears immediately after cleaning photos with stay details pre-loaded. Star rating + optional comment = 15 seconds. Completion rate >70% for stays 1-3.

elements.name: Same-as-Last-Time One-Tap Review
elements.description: The repeat review variant for stays 5+. Shows pre-filled stars from last review with a large, prominent 'Same as last time âœ“' button. One tap = review submitted using prior rating + auto-generated comment. Guest can still manually adjust if needed, but default is instant confirmation. This is the core long-loop simplification that maintains >60% completion through stay 12.

visual_spec.layout: Button-first layout: Large 'Same as last time' button at top (full card width), then pre-filled stars below (visible but lower opacity), optional comment field collapsed. Button dominates visual hierarchy.

interaction_spec.default: Large purple pill button prominent at top of card. Pre-filled stars visible below at 60% opacity with small label 'From your last review' above them. Stars editable if guest wants to change.

interaction_spec.hover: Button background darkens to #8C68EE, scales to 1.02x. Cursor pointer.
interaction_spec.click: Button tap triggers loading sequence. If guest taps star instead, button fades out (200ms opacity to 0) and standard submit button appears at bottom.
interaction_spec.success: Checkmark animation completes, card dismisses, toast notification: 'Review submittedâ€”same as last time!'

before_after.before: Every review requires full re-entry of rating and comment, even if experience is identical to previous stay. By stay 5, guests abandon due to repetition fatigue.
before_after.after: One tap confirms previous rating is still accurate. Takes 5 seconds. By stay 5, >50% of reviews use this option. Maintains >60% completion through stay 12.

elements.name: Review Thank You Moment
elements.description: The confirmation screen shown immediately after review submission. This is the 'Signature Moment' that transforms transactional ('Thank you') into communal ('You're helping 50+ guests right now'). Shows specific impact metrics with gentle animation. Warm, personal language. No secondary requests (no 'share this' or 'rate us'). Creates genuine reciprocity feeling.

visual_spec.layout: Centered vertical layout. Large checkmark icon at top, headline below, body text, impact metrics in horizontal row with icons, close button at bottom. Max width 400px.

interaction_spec.default: Card appears with checkmark animation (scale from 0.8x to 1.0x, 300ms spring). Impact numbers increment from 0 to target value (500ms). Small avatar icons fade in below stats.
interaction_spec.loading: N/Aâ€”card appears after review already submitted.
interaction_spec.hover: Close button background lightens on hover.
interaction_spec.click: Close button dismisses card with 300ms fade-out.

before_after.after: Specific impact data ('50+ guests helped') with warm, personal acknowledgment ('You've reviewed 5 stays'). Guest feels appreciated and sees their contribution matters.

elements.name: Review Progress Tracker
elements.description: Small widget showing review completion progress ('Stay 5 of 12 reviewed') with a minimal progress bar. Motivates completion by showing 'end is in sight' without pressuring. Appears at top-right of review card. Creates sense of accomplishment and momentum. The progress bar fills smoothly (300ms animation) when card appears.

visual_spec.layout: Horizontal row: text label on left ('Stay 5 of 12'), progress bar on right (80px wide, 2px height). Sits at top-right of review card as subtle ambient indicator.

interaction_spec.default: Text and bar visible at top of card. Bar shows progress as filled percentage (e.g., 41% for stay 5 of 12).
interaction_spec.hover: Bar fill brightens slightly to show it's informational, not interactive.
interaction_spec.success: For final review (stay 12 of 12), text changes to 'ðŸŽ‰ Final review!' and bar shows 100% with gold accent color.

elements.name: Pricing Clarity Card
elements.description: Addresses Tapper's pricing confusion with dramatic typographic hierarchy. Total lease cost displayed at 36px bold purple, per-month breakdown at 18px, calculation details at 12px expandable. Per-bedroom clarification shown immediately with orange warning badge if applicable. Uses monospace font for all numbers to signal precision. Shows budget comparison if guest provided budget.

typography.font: IBM Plex Mono for numbers, Inter for labels

visual_spec.layout: Top-heavy hierarchy. Total cost dominates at top (36px, bold, purple). Per-month breakdown below (18px). Expandable 'See breakdown' section (12px). Warning badge for per-bedroom pricing immediately below total. Budget comparison badge if applicable.

interaction_spec.default: Total cost visible and dominant. Per-month shown below. 'See breakdown' link collapsed. Warning badge visible if per-bedroom pricing.
interaction_spec.loading: N/Aâ€”pricing calculated on server before display.
interaction_spec.hover: 'See breakdown' link underlines on hover. Warning badge background slightly darkens on hover.
interaction_spec.click: 'See breakdown' expands to show per-night Ã— nights Ã— weeks calculation plus fee breakdown.
interaction_spec.success: Budget comparison badge shows green checkmark if within budget.

elements.name: Review History Timeline
elements.description: Guest-facing dashboard showing complete review history across stays. Shows star ratings, comment excerpts, host responses, and 'X guests found this helpful' metrics. Summary stats at top: 'You've written 8 reviews â€¢ 85 guests found them helpful â€¢ Top 20% of reviewers.' Creates sense of contribution and motivates continued participation through visible impact.

visual_spec.layout: Summary stats in horizontal row at top (3 cards side-by-side). Review list below in reverse chronological order. Each review card shows property thumbnail, name, date, stars, comment excerpt. Expandable for full details.

interaction_spec.default: Summary stats visible at top. Review cards in list below, collapsed (showing first 50 chars of comment). Newest review at top.
interaction_spec.loading: Skeleton screens while reviews load from API.
interaction_spec.hover: Review cards shadow increases on hover. 'See more' link underlines.
interaction_spec.click: Tapping review card expands to show full comment, host response, helpfulness metric.
interaction_spec.empty: If no reviews yet: 'You haven't reviewed any stays yet. Your first review will appear here.'

elements.name: Acceptance Phase Review Norm Banner
elements.description: Callout box in lease confirmation email explaining stay-by-stay review system. Light purple background (#F7F2FA), rounded corners, calendar icon, 'How Reviews Work' heading. Copy emphasizes mutual benefit, brevity (15 seconds), and community trust. Includes small preview image of review interface. Sets expectations proactively to prevent surprise and resistance when review requests arrive.

spacing.margin: 32px above and below box in email

visual_spec.layout: Centered box within email, max 600px width. Calendar icon (24px) at top-left. Heading below icon. Body text (2-3 sentences). Preview image of review card below text (200px wide). All elements centered within box.

interaction_spec.default: Static callout box in email. No interactive statesâ€”informational only.

copy_spec.headline: How Reviews Work
copy_spec.body: After each stay, we'll invite you to share quick feedback (15 seconds). These stay-by-stay reviews help future guests find great spaces and help hosts improve. They're a core part of how Split Lease builds trust. Your first review will come after your first stay on Nov 3.

elements.html_css:
Congratulations! Your lease for Riverside Studio has been confirmed. Here's what to expect next:

How Reviews Work

After each stay, we'll invite you to share quick feedback (15 seconds). These stay-by-stay reviews help future guests find great spaces and help hosts improve continuously. They're a core part of how Split Lease builds trust.

Your first review will come after your first stay on November 3.

We're excited to welcome you to the Split Lease community!

before_after.before: First review request arrives unexpectedly. Guest thinks 'What is this? I didn't sign up for weekly reviews!' Feels like spam. Resistance and confusion.
before_after.after: Guest recalls lease confirmation explanation: 'Oh right, they told me reviews happen after each stay.' Expectation was set. Review request feels normal and fair.

elements.name: Bid Acceptance Likelihood Indicator
elements.description: Real-time acceptance likelihood percentage shown during bid creation. Updates as guest adjusts nights, budget, dates. Color-coded (red <30%, orange 30-60%, green >60%). When likelihood is low, shows specific optimization tip: 'Dropping Sunday night could increase to 65%.' Expandable 'How is this calculated?' provides transparency. Creates empowerment through data-driven guidance.

visual_spec.layout: Compact card below night selection interface. Large percentage number on left, color-coded. Tip text on right if <50%. 'How is this calculated?' link at bottom, expandable.

interaction_spec.default: Card visible with current acceptance likelihood. Updates in real-time as guest adjusts nights. Tip appears if likelihood <50%.
interaction_spec.loading: Brief spinner (200ms) while recalculating after night selection change.
interaction_spec.hover: Card background lightens slightly. 'How is this calculated?' link underlines.
interaction_spec.click: 'How is this calculated?' expands to show data explanation: 'Based on 2,000+ similar bids in this neighborhood.'
interaction_spec.empty: If no data available: 'Not enough data for this configuration.'
interaction_spec.success: Green background with checkmark when likelihood >60%.
